snippet: Emphasizing that the investigation was still going on, the president suggested that the Tsarnaev brothers were “self-radicalized,” making a potential plot harder to prevent.
abstract: Pres Obama offers measured support for Federal Bureau of Investigation's handling of tip from Russian intelligence about Boston Marathon bombing suspect Tamerlan Tsarnaev; says his administration will investigate to see if more could have been done to prevent attack.

byline.original: By SCOTT SHANE and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Scott Shane reported from Washington, and Ellen Barry from Moscow. Michael S. Schmidt contributed reporting from Washington, Serge F. Kovaleski from New York, and Andrew Roth from Makhachkala, Russia.

lead_paragraph: Emphasizing that the investigation was still going on, the president suggested that the Tsarnaev brothers were “self-radicalized,” making a potential plot harder to prevent.

headline.main: As Bombing Inquiry Proceeds, Obama Offers Measured Praise for F.B.I.
headline.print_headline: As Bombing Inquiry Proceeds, Obama Offers Measured Praise for F.B.I.
